content.raw:
Actually I replied too fast before. It is actually easier than that: all dependencies of a non-development package are automatically determined by the libraries against which you are linking yourself. This is contained in the ${shlibs:Depends} variable you have to use when declaring you dependencies.

See here: http://anonscm.debian.org/gitweb/?p=debian-science/packages/gazebo.git;a=blob;f=debian/control;h=b4822097ca176360b91fb062c9e5b75bd12ffc96;hb=HEAD

On the opposite, the -dev dependencies have to be declared manually in the -dev packages.
The reason is that it is easy to extract binaries dependencies (ldd + apt-file search for instance is enough) whereas when it comes to headers, the conditional inclusions of headers makes it a very difficult problem. Hence, the manual declaration of dependencies of the development packages.

A non -dev package should probably not depend (or recommends/suggests for that matter) a -dev package. Please, make it either a dependency of libgazebo-dev (or a suggestion) depending of whether this is a mandatory library for *developing* a plug-in or not.
